org.gvsig.raster.cache.buffer

Interface Band

  • All Superinterfaces:
    StatsValues

    public interface Band
extends StatsValues
    Interface implemented by a raster band

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Ancho de la banda
        Returns:
        Entero con el ancho de la banda

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Alto de la banda
        Returns:
        Entero con el alto de la banda

      • getDataType

        int getDataType()
        Obtiene el tipo de dato. Los tipos de dato posibles están definidos en IRaster.
        Returns:
        tipo de datos

      • getBlockSize

        int getBlockSize()
        Gets the height of each minimum data block. For instance, when you're using a cache the BlockSize is the height of one piece of cache. If it is a vertical cache the BlockSize is the width of each block.
        Returns:
        size of minimum data block

      • getNumberOfBlocks

        int getNumberOfBlocks()
        Gets the number of blocks
        Returns:
        integer that represents the number of blocks

      • isHorizontalBlock

        boolean isHorizontalBlock()
        Returns true if the block is horizontal and false if is not
        Returns:
        integer that represents the number of blocks

        Gets the band number
        Returns:
        band number

      • getByteBlock

        byte[][] getByteBlock(int block)
        Gets a minimum block of data. The height of this data block is getBlockHeight pixels.
        Returns:
        Data buffer in memory. This is an array of two dimensions (width x heigth).

      • getShortBlock

        short[][] getShortBlock(int block)
        Gets a minimum block of data. The height of this data block is getBlockHeight pixels.

        byte[] getByteLine(int line)
                   throws OperationNotSupportedException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Array unidimensional que representa la línea de datos.

        OperationNotSupportedException

      • setByteBlock

        void setByteBlock(byte[][] data,
                int block)
                  throws OperationNotSupportedException
        Sets a minimum byte block. The height of this data block is getBlockHeight pixels.
        Parameters:
        data - Data buffer in memory. This is an array of two dimensions (width x heigth).
        block - Number of block to assign
        Throws:
        OperationNotSupportedException
